comment: The product of two monomials adds the exponent vectors together. For example, the product of ` ( x ^ 2 ) ( y ^ 2 ) ` with ` ( y ^ 1 ) ( z ^ 3 ) ` is ` ( x ^ 2 ) ( y ^ 3 ) ( z ^ 3 ) ` , where the exponent vectors ` <. 2 , 2 , 0 >. ` and ` <. 0 , 1 , 3 >. ` are added to give ` <. 2 , 3 , 3 >. ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Jan-2015.)
